conclusion: Objects A and B move through the air and are placed at the location of objects A, B, C, and D.
Arrows indicate locations: A points to purple fabric, B to plaid fabric, C to white block, D to brown block.
Gravity causes downward movement and contact with surfaces.
Moving objects under gravity come into contact with solid surfaces and experience a normal force.
Normal force counteracts gravity, causing objects to decelerate and stop.
Moving objects A and B will settle on surfaces at locations A, B, C, and D.
Objects A and B are directed towards locations A, B, C, and D.
Gravity pulls objects A and B downwards.
Objects A and B make contact with surfaces at locations A, B, C, and D.
Surfaces provide a normal force opposing gravity.
Objects A and B stop their downward movement and rest on surfaces.
Objects A and B will settle and rest on purple fabric, plaid fabric, white block, and brown block.
